result.execSummary:
The defendant Roberto Navarrete was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Kenosha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Bond to be applied  -  Balance to be paid during probation. 
  If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*  Pay fine of $500  and court costs including all applicable surcharges.  Cash bond posted shall be applied.   
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
*  Pay DNA surcharge.    
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Weapon must be destroyed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State. Defendant, Roberto Navarrete, appeared.  (Court Reporter: T. Czarnecki)  Clerk: PT
Defendant waives his right to an attorney.  Case is resolved and State is compliant with victim rights notification.  Deft. pleads No Contest; found guilty by the court.  Sentencing argument made.  Sentence is withheld; Deft. placed on probation for 6 months with conditions.  Fined $500 plus costs.  Cash Bond on desposit shall be applied and remaining balance to be paid during probation.  Appeal Rights given.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.  kmk

244pm
  Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk LE.  Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.  Not guilty plea entered by court on behalf of DE.  PTC on 1/30/15 @ 140pm.  FPT on 2/13/15 @ 840am.  $150  Continued Posted Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).

CONTINUED POSTED
  *No Contact w/ Timothy J C or his residence  **NO Weapons
